usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: The script generates 3D physical entities (Beam, Sheet, MetalPart) using Beam().Create() and Sheet().dbCreate(). It interacts directly with the 3D Element structure using getElement() and assigns entities to element groups. There are no references to _Viewport, sd_ prefixes, or 2D drawing generation logic typical of Shop Drawing scripts.

opmProperties.description: Specifies the thickness for the steel plate.
Specifies the center offset for the steel plate.

contextMenu.action: Erases existing beams and sheets stored in _Map

scriptPurpose.summary: Generates a structural wind brace (K-brace configuration) within a wall element, including diagonal timber struts, a central vertical post, steel connection plates, and optional sheathing panels.
scriptPurpose.typicalUseCase: Providing lateral stability (racking resistance) to a timber wall panel where standard sheathing is insufficient, or to meet specific engineering load requirements with a visible timber brace.

parameters.name: frameBeamWidth
parameters.businessMeaning: The width (thickness) of the diagonal timber beams creating the brace.
parameters.affectsOutput: Geometry of the diagonal beams; size of the cutouts in the main wall structure; size of required steel plates.

parameters.name: frameBeamHeight
parameters.businessMeaning: The height/depth of the diagonal timber beams.
parameters.affectsOutput: Geometry of the diagonal beams; structural capacity.

parameters.name: frameBeamColor
parameters.businessMeaning: The display color of the diagonal brace beams in the CAD model.

parameters.name: centerBeamWidth
parameters.businessMeaning: The width (thickness) of the central vertical post (king post) of the brace.
parameters.affectsOutput: Geometry of the central post; intersection geometry with diagonal beams.

parameters.name: centerBeamHeight
parameters.businessMeaning: The height/depth of the central vertical post.
parameters.affectsOutput: Geometry of the central post; structural capacity.

parameters.name: steelPlateWidth
parameters.businessMeaning: The width of the gusset plates connecting the brace members.
parameters.affectsOutput: Size of the MetalPart entities; overlap area with timber members.

parameters.name: steelPlateHeight
parameters.businessMeaning: The height of the gusset plates.

parameters.name: steelPlateThickness
parameters.businessMeaning: The material thickness of the steel gusset plates.
parameters.affectsOutput: Thickness of the 3D steel plates; offsets the brace geometry slightly to account for material stack-up.

parameters.name: steelPlateOffset
parameters.businessMeaning: Shifts the steel plates along the length of the wall (Y-axis) to fine-tune placement relative to studs.
parameters.affectsOutput: Position of the MetalPart entities along the wall length.

parameters.name: centerBeamPosition
parameters.businessMeaning: Determines if the central vertical post is aligned to the Front, Center, or Back of the wall thickness.
parameters.affectsOutput: Z-depth location of the center beam; affects how diagonals intersect the post.

parameters.name: frameSideOffset
parameters.businessMeaning: Lateral offset of the brace assembly from the insertion point.
parameters.affectsOutput: Shifts the entire brace geometry laterally within the wall bay.

parameters.name: bracePosition
parameters.businessMeaning: Determines if the diagonal beams are aligned to the Front, Center, or Back of the wall thickness.
parameters.affectsOutput: Z-depth location of the diagonal beams; affects positioning of sheathing.

parameters.name: sheetThickness
parameters.businessMeaning: Thickness of the structural sheathing (plywood/OSB) filling the brace area.
parameters.affectsOutput: 3D thickness of the sheet entities; offsets the sheet surface to sit flush with the brace.

parameters.name: sheetDescription
parameters.businessMeaning: Text description of the sheet material (e.g., 'OSB 18mm').
parameters.affectsOutput: Data field only; appears in reports/lists.

parameters.name: sheetColor
parameters.businessMeaning: The display color of the sheathing panels.

parameters.name: nColor
parameters.businessMeaning: Color of the 2D symbol representation in plan/section views.
parameters.affectsOutput: Visual representation of the TSL symbol.

parameters.name: dSymbolSize
parameters.businessMeaning: Scale/size of the 2D brace symbol drawn on the element.
parameters.affectsOutput: Visual size of the generic brace symbol in plans.

parameterDependencies.effect: Recalculates the Z-depth coordinates of the generated beams to ensure they align correctly within the wall layers.
Adjusts the outer surface position of the sheathing sheets to maintain flushness with the outer surface of the frame beams.
Adjusts the offset of the brace members slightly to account for the plate material at the joints.

outputEntities.description: Two diagonal beams forming the wind brace (top and bottom).
One vertical center post (king post) intersected by the diagonals.
Two rectangular sheets (front and back) filling the brace area for structural stability.
Four steel gusset plates (Top, Bottom, Center-Top, Center-Bottom) connecting the beams.
2D lines and text indicating the presence of the brace module in plan views.

workflowDiagram: [Branch: Insert Mode] Show Dynamic Dialog (if not executing from catalog/key)
[Branch: Insert Mode] Prompt User to Select Wall Element
[Branch: Insert Mode] Prompt User to Select Insertion Point
[Branch: Insert Mode] Project Point to Element Mid-Plane
[Branch: Insert Mode] Set ExecuteMode Flag and Exit
[Branch: Calculation Mode] Check for 'Delete' Context Trigger
[Branch: Calculation Mode] Check for 'Recalculate' / 'DoubleClick' Trigger (Erase existing entities)
Identify Bounding Structure (Find Top, Bottom, Left, Right beams)
[Conditional] Adjust Geometry based on Brace Position (Front/Center/Back)

path1.name: Valid Structure Found
steps: Retrieve Left, Right, Top, Bottom beams

path2.name: Missing Structure
steps: Report Warning ('Invalid side studs' or 'Invalid plates')

path1.name: Back Position (Index 2)
steps: Apply offset to steel plate origins (Z-axis shift)
Adjust sheet thickness calculation relative to beam width

path2.name: Front or Center Position
steps: Standard geometry calculation without Z-axis offset adjustment

validationRules.errorMessage: Implicit (Script deletes self if element is invalid)
validationRules.recovery: Ensure the TSL is attached to a valid, non-deleted wall element.

validationRules.check: Dimension Parameters (centerBeamWidth, centerBeamHeight, frameBeamWidth, frameBeamHeight, steelPlateWidth, steelPlateHeight, steelPlateThickness)
validationRules.errorMessage: One of the properties was not set properly, TSL will be deleted.
validationRules.recovery: Set all beam and plate dimensions to values greater than 0 in the properties palette.

validationRules.errorMessage: Invalid side studs. OR Invalid plates.
validationRules.recovery: Ensure the insertion point is within a bay defined by vertical studs and horizontal top/bottom plates.

postInsertionActions.effect: Updates dimensions (width/height), offsets, and positioning of all generated beams and plates immediately.

postInsertionActions.how: Context Menu (Right-click) -> Recalculate OR Double Click
postInsertionActions.effect: Erases existing generated beams and sheets, then recreates them based on current bounding beam geometry and properties.
Erases the TSL instance and removes all generated geometry from the model.

postInsertionActions.how: OPM Properties (Brace Position, Center Beam Position)
postInsertionActions.effect: Moves the timber members and steel plates between Front, Center, and Back alignment within the wall thickness.

data.markdown:
# HSB_W-WindBrace.mcr

## Overview
This script automatically generates a structural wind brace (K-brace configuration) within a selected timber wall element. It creates diagonal timber struts, a central vertical post, steel connection gusset plates, and optional structural sheathing panels to provide lateral stability.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | This script generates 3D physical entities (beams, sheets, metal plates). |
| Paper Space | No | Not applicable for 2D layout generation. |
| Shop Drawing | No | This is a modeling script for 3D construction. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required entities**: A valid Wall Element containing vertical GenBeams (studs) and horizontal GenBeams (top/bottom plates).
- **Minimum beam count**: 4 beams (to form a valid bay bounded by two studs and two plates).
- **Required settings files**: None.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT`
Action: Select `HSB_W-WindBrace.mcr` from the file list.

### Step 2: Select Wall Element
```
Command Line: Select wall element
Action: Click on the wall element (or a beam belonging to it) where you want to install the brace.
```

### Step 3: Select Position
```
Command Line: Select a position
Action: Click inside the specific bay (the space between two vertical studs) where you want the center of the wind brace to be located.
```

### Step 4: Configure (Optional)
Action: If the configuration dialog appears, adjust the initial dimensions or material settings as needed and click OK. The brace will then generate.

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| **Frame beams** | | | |
| Frame beam width | Number | 25 mm | The width (thickness) of the diagonal timber beams. |
| Frame beam height | Number | 25 mm | The height/depth of the diagonal timber beams. |
| Frame beam color | Number | 1 | The display color index of the diagonal beams. |
| **Supporting beam** | | | |
| Center beam width | Number | 25 mm | The width (thickness) of the central vertical post (king post). |
| Center beam height | Number | 25 mm | The height/depth of the central vertical post. |
| Center beam position | Dropdown | Center | Sets the alignment of the center post: Front, Center, or Back. |
| **Steel plates** | | | |
| Steel plate width | Number | 25 mm | The width of the steel gusset plates. |
| Steel plate height | Number | 25 mm | The height of the steel gusset plates. |
| Steel plate thickness | Number | 25 mm | The material thickness of the steel plates. |
| Steel plate center offset | Number | 10 mm | Shifts the steel plates along the length of the wall (Y-axis). |
| **Positioning** | | | |
| Frame side offset | Number | 5 mm | Lateral offset of the brace assembly from the insertion point. |
| Brace position | Dropdown | Center | Sets the alignment of the diagonal beams: Front, Center, or Back. |
| **Sheeting** | | | |
| Sheet thickness | Number | 10 mm | Thickness of the structural sheathing (plywood/OSB) filling the brace area. |
| Sheet description | Text | - | Text description for reports (e.g., "OSB 18mm"). |
| Sheet color | Number | 1 | The display color index of the sheathing panels. |
| **Display** | | | |
| Color | Number | 8 | The display color index of the 2D symbol in plan views. |
| Symbol size | Number | 80 mm | The scale/size of the 2D brace symbol. |

## Right-Click Menu Options

| Menu Item | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Recalculate | Deletes the currently generated beams and sheets and regenerates them based on current properties and wall geometry. This is also triggered by double-clicking the script instance. |
| Delete | Removes the TSL instance and all generated geometry (beams, plates, sheets) from the model. |

## Settings Files
- None used.

## Tips
- **Valid Bay Requirement**: The script will delete itself if you do not click inside a valid bay. Ensure the point is clearly bounded by vertical studs and horizontal top/bottom plates.
- **Positioning**: Use the `Brace position` and `Center beam position` properties to handle layer conflicts. For example, set the brace to "Back" if you need to avoid clashing with services in the front of the wall.
- **Quick Update**: Simply double-click the generated brace symbol or instance to force a recalculation if the wall shape changes.

## FAQ
- **Q: Why did the script disappear immediately after I selected a point?**
  **A**: The script could not find a valid boundary (Top Plate, Bottom Plate, Left Stud, Right Stud) at the location you clicked. Ensure you are clicking inside a regular stud bay.
- **Q: Can I use this on curved walls?**
  **A**: The script is designed for standard linear wall elements. It relies on finding intersecting beams which may not function predictably on complex curved geometry.
- **Q: How do I change the size of the steel plates?**
  **A**: Select the script instance, open the Properties palette (OPM), and modify the `Steel plate width`, `height`, or `thickness` values under the "Steel plates" category. The 3D model will update automatically.
